info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 4:20PM EDT until August 21 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilton Head Island, Bluffton, Jasper, Hardeeville, Rose Hill, Sun City, Pritchardville, Calawassie Island, Lemon Island, Shell Point, Burton, Palmetto Bluff, Myrtle Island, Brighton Beach, Chelsea, Okatie, Caril Bowers Bridge, Wilton Graves Bridge, Levy and Coastal Carolina Hospital.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
